intro: Achillea grata, commonly known as sweet yarrow, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has feathery, aromatic leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Sweet yarrow is also valued for its historical use in herbal medicine.
